review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

Ужасный заброшенный платформер.

Прыгаем по уровням за зеленого слизня и собираем бесполезные алмазы. Наш слизень может прыгать от стен и трансформировываться во врагов, чтобы проходить через разные преграды. Игра была выпущена в 2015 году и, в сравнении с релизной версией, игра поменялась, но осталась все такой же отвратительной. У этой игры много минусов:
[list]
[*]Ужасный дизайн игры и уровней.
[*]Подача "сюжета" в виде появляющегося текста, который даже, 6лять, нельзя быстро проскипать.
[*]Миниигры и [b]настройки[/b] были вырезаны.
[*]Из 4-ех наборов уровней (?) доступен лишь один на 8 уровней.
[*]Тупые достижения - например, собрать 2000 алмазов, когда за одно прохождение вы соберете ~30 алмазов.
[/list]

[b]1/10 - полный кал, не стоит и 15 рублей.[/b]

review:
Blob From Space, JosPlays tarafından geliştirilen ve yayınlanan bir 2D yan kaydırma oyunudur. Oyun, çoklu evrenin Savunucularına katılan Blob'un kökenini araştıran etkileşimli bir hikaye moduna sahiptir. Oyun öğrenmesi kolay olacak şekilde tasarlanmıştır, ancak ilerledikçe giderek zorlaşan zorlu seviyeleri vardır.

Blob From Space'in benzersiz özelliklerinden biri, oyuna ilginç bir dokunuş katan düşmanlara dönüşme yeteneğidir. Ayrıca oyun, oyuncuların daha önce deneyimlenmemiş bir şekilde duvardan atlamasına olanak tanır.

Oyun ayrıca ileride yayınlanacak ve her biri yeni başarıların kilidini açacak mini oyunlar da içeriyor.

Genel olarak, Blob From Space, becerilerinizi test edecek ve takip etmek için ilginç bir hikaye sağlayacak eğlenceli ve zorlu bir oyundur. Oyun, meydan okumayı seven 2D yan kaydırma oyunlarının hayranları için mükemmeldir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1679243038}
review:
Blob From Space is yet another of literally thousands of 2D retro pixel platformers infesting Steam and lowering the average quality of all video games everywhere.  The game was copy + pasted using stock tilesets and a platformer template.  And if you're wondering, of course the "developer" didn't credit the people who made the tilesets or the game engine, instead preferring to claim their work as his own.  

It's garbage as far as platformers go.  While the game does use the stock GameMaker platforming engine, so controls are tight enough, they're not perfect.  Level design is sloppy and uninteresting, and the gameplay is the same old tired dead gameplay we can expect from the obsolete, dead 2D platformer genre (although there's a "cloning" gimmick, it's used poorly and adds little to a bland, overdone experience with no value for gamers). 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

A choice was made to use obsolete, decades old retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget or talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers.

Some of the defects in the game can be attributed to the choice of using the GameMaker Studio construction kit/toolset.  This is a very poor quality toolset favoured by amateur developers as it's cheap and requires little in the way of development skill, but unfortunately has very limited capabilities.  Just as you can't make a silk purse out of a sows ear, you can't make a great video game if you use a terrible engine.  GameMaker Studio is most commonly used to make retro pixel shovelware and cash grabs.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

You don't have to take my word about how bad the game is, we can measure the interest in a game by how much people bothered to play it.  Blob From Space has achievements, and they show us a very clear picture that the game absolutely failed to capture any interest from gamers.  The most commonly and easily attained achievement is for completing the tutorial, trivial to do, but less than 5 percent of players bothered to get that far before uninstalling the game.  That's a tiny, tiny proportion of gamers who even bothered with this.  Ouch.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the game.  But this isn't consistent with the achievement stats, that show only 5 percent of players bothered playing the game for any reasonable amount of time.  How is it possible for this game to have so many concurrent players who weren't even playing the   Trading cards.  Players will use card idling software to collect the cards and sell them, but this won't trigger any achievements in-game.  That tells us people only really bought this game for trading cards, and that's a damning indictment of the woeful quality.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

Blob From Space is relatively cheap at $2 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1641398979}
review:
A blob that should have never left space.

Story:

You play as a small blob who is supposed to help the defenders of the multiverse stop an evil force from taking over. Yeah that's about all there is. The story is actually just not very interesting, simply because it just makes no sense. There are times where the game just sort of stops and puts up a wall of text as an update.

Also there's choices that affect the outcome of the story and genuinely the only real choice that matters is the final one that ends up giving you a different ending and all the other ones, just sort of give you different achievements, that's really all there is to it. 

Graphics:

Visually Blob from Space looks like it was slapped up together in MS paint. It just looks horrible. Levels look visually ugly, there's tons of clone enemies that don't look interesting and animations look kind of laggy and very choppy. Also the levels look really messy and since they're pretty big, you can get lost in certain levels. 

Audio:

The soundtrack is really bland and every track that is used throughout the game just constantly loops and it wouldn't be as bad if the soundtrack was actually catchy or actually good, but all of it sounds like stock free soundtrack someone just quickly ripped off the internet. 

There's not much in other audio design. There are a few sound effects like collecting items, but that's about it. It's not bad, but nothing really good either about it either, just sounds cheap which I guess goes with everything else the game has on display. 

Gameplay:

Blob From Space is a 2D Platformer where your main goal is to reach the end of the level all while avoiding enemies and collecting items like gems, diamonds and hats, but none of that really matters, the end of the level is the only goal that really matters.

Before I begin I have to give a warning right away. The game was in early access and was in development for years and I finally decided to check it out once I saw it had left EA, however the developers just removed the EA tag and released the game without any further updates. It's only the tutorial planet, out of the four planned planets.

Blob From Space is a horrible game and honestly it's incredibly unfun to play. It boils down to horrible controls and absolutely atrocious level design. The blob controls incredibly stiff and since certain jumps are super tight, you can easily overshoot and land on an enemy or undershoot and drop off the map.

Also the camera doesn't properly follows you, so with massive levels you sometimes seemingly come up to a dead end, when in reality to advance you have to make a really tight leap of faith and this is not a one time thing, it's happens multiple times in the tutorial planet and once you lose all your lives, you simply have to go back to the beginning of the planet. 

The settings also don't work, basically the only two features that work is play game and quit, everything else just sort of does nothing, which is just the icing on the cake of this games horrible design and speaking of horrible design I'll end off on the horrible transformation mechanic.

You encounter enemies like a flying one and you can rip it's power and give yourself it's powers. A cool feature yes, but it makes controlling the game even harder for some reason and it also makes you a much easier target considering you move slower and become a bigger target to be taken out by enemies meaning back to the beginning with you.

Verdict:

Blob From Space is a horrendous game. Don't let the cheap price deceive you, this game is an unfinished mess and is absolutely not worth playing or even buying. Stay away from this game at all costs.

Final Rating:
1/10

Pros:
N/A

Cons:
- Horrible gameplay
- Awful sound design 
- Was left unfinished 
- Level design is too big and has tons of faith based jumps 
- Story is a generic mess

author: {'steamid': '76561198796851430', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 3717, 'playtime_forever': 6014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6014, 'last_played': 1651750651}
review:
起初，《Blob From Space》以其异想天开的概念和类似经典作品《Tales From Space: Mutant Blobs Attack!》的独特风格吸引了我。然而在深入体验这款游戏后，我发现了一些难以忽视的问题，以至于我对这款游戏的总体评价趋向负面。

首先游戏的核心玩法——操控不断成长的外星生物Blob吞噬一切来壮大自身——在理论上颇具吸引力。但在实际操作中，游戏的控制反馈并不理想，Blob的移动和吞噬动作响应迟钝，经常造成玩家对游戏节奏把控上的困扰。特别是在面对复杂环境和快节奏挑战时，这种不流畅的操作手感大大降低了游戏的乐趣。

其次尽管游戏主打无尽吞噬与成长的设定，但关卡设计过于单一，重复度较高。在经过最初的几个小时游玩后，玩家很容易陷入单调乏味的循环之中，缺乏足够的变化和新鲜感来保持持续的吸引力。此外游戏中并未充分利用Blob的变异能力进行更深层次的游戏机制探索，令潜在的游戏深度未能得以发挥。

在视觉和音频效果方面同样存在不足。虽然游戏的艺术风格独具特色，但粗糙的图形细节和平淡的配色方案让整体画面显得廉价，缺乏生动活泼的气息。同时游戏的音效设计过于简单，背景音乐缺乏变化，听觉体验颇为单调，未能营造出太空冒险应有的神秘氛围。

最后不得不提的是游戏的技术性能问题。不少玩家反馈在运行时遭遇了频繁的卡顿和偶尔的崩溃现象，这些问题不仅打断了游戏进程，还严重影响了整体的游戏体验。

综上所述，虽有着吸引人的主题和创意，但在实际游玩中，由于操作手感欠佳、关卡设计重复、视听体验平庸以及技术稳定性问题，使得这款游戏难以脱颖而出，无法给玩家带来持久且满意的游戏享受。希望开发团队能在后续更新中针对以上问题做出重大改进，从而提升游戏的整体品质。

review:
一款不怎么样的平台跳跃游戏
操作比较别扭，尤其攀墙跳跃，比较不习惯

另外，主菜单里的options、minigames两个选项完全不能点，这个是做什么用的？
如果插上手柄后，在主菜单解密就会看到选框在乱转，如果按下确定的话还会拼RP是开始游戏还是退出游戏
总之这游戏的质量看上去就值6元钱

review:
[h1] Бондюэль[/h1]

Играем мы за что-то похожее на разлагающийся зелёный горошек. Геймплейная часть позаимствована у [i] Super Meat Boy[/i], та же механика, но уровни уже свои собственные, не похожие. Правда, они всё равно так себе. 4 мира, в каждом несколько уровней, на прохождение которых даётся 3 жизни. Если наумирал где-то посередине, то начинай сначала весь мир – стыдно, конечно, на такое жаловаться, но как никак уже ушло то время. Так же присутствует такой недоработанный момент, когда, находясь в верхней части уровня, совершая прыжок, пропадаешь с экрана, и можно лишь гадать куда шлёпнется наш слизень. По традиции сюжет представлен пару маленькими абзацами и будет развиваться в таком же темпе и с таким же объёмом.

Как и полагается, графон, да хотя бы просто левел дизайн приемлемый, отсутствуют. Помимо этого, ещё присутствуют лесенки. Звук примитивный, с музыкой дела несколько лучше, однако это всё равно не дотягивает до «нормально». По поводу меню, зачем делать раздел мини игры и настройки, если они не работают?!

Выход в ранний доступ состоялся в 2014 году, до сих пор игра находится в нём, среди купивших лишь двое написали обзор, это ли не лучший показатель того, что стоит пройти мимо этой игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108852006', 'num_games_owned': 9335, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1430839238}
review:
Okay, you get two versions of this game. The original 2014 version that looks like it's created using MS Paint and uses up for jumping. Then there's the new version which looks slightly better and introduces the worst ever implementation of wall jumping. The controls in both versions are really bad and in an insta-death platformer that's not a good thing at all. Those problems are severe, but if the game had at least any interesting levels or something else that would warrant playing the game, I wouldn't mind the control problems that much. Unfortunately both versions have bland, boring and unimaginative level with only one saving grace: You can turn into monsters to overcome certain parts of the levels. While this idea is quite good, the combination of controls and poor level design just make it absolutely frustrating to use.

The one interesting aspect of the game is hindered by a poor presentation, horrible controls and boring level design. Really not worth your time and there has to be a landslide of improvements (given there is already a second version) before this game is worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128239804', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1601245633}
review:
Blob from Space es un juego de plataformas aburrido, técnicamente pobre, inacabado y nada recomendable.
Sus gráficos parecen dignos de Paint, extremadamente simples y sin gracia. La música, olvidable y falta de variedad.
La jugabilidad es muy pobre, con movimientos poco precisos y con un diseño de niveles que deja mucho que desear. Además, después de años en Early Access, el juego se muestra incompleto con opciones del menú que no funcionan y con una historia corta, mal narrada e igualmente inacabada.
Su dificultad carece de curva y es producto de la falta de precisión en los saltos. Además, viene aderezada con una durabilidad extremadamente corta (8 niveles realmente pequeños). En mi caso he llegado a jugarlo durante varias horas, porque he ido probando desde hace años las actualizaciones que se iban haciendo, aunque ya parece claro que el juego se encuentra abandonado. Lo cierto es que no me sorprende, porque no se sostiene por ningún lado.
Sin duda uno de esos títulos a evitar en el Catálogo de Steam. No merece la pena jugarlo, ni gratis. Es una pérdida de tiempo. De lo peor que he jugado en los últimos años.

NOTA 1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198018715489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1425815548}
review:
Un jeux qui peine à trouvé du contenu à ce mettre sous la dent. Je suis le jeux depuis sa sortie et bon dieu que j'ai été de nombreuse fois décu par ses Update. Blob From Space commence sans expliquations et sans scénario et ont se plonge dans un univers en 2D Side Scroller tres tres basique. Les commandes sont juste affreuses et réponde une fois sur 2, la musique est vraiment pas térrible et je passe des BUGS qu'il peut y avoir sur tout le jeux et un développement assez foireux (La mort instantanée sans animation ou autre... On m'explique ?). Le jeux cherche à être "dur" mais dans le fond, il est plus ridicule qu'autre chose, ont passe du temps à se baladé en recommencant éternellement le même niveau à cause de bug ou de commandes qui foire totalement au moment ou il faut le moins. Certes l'idée de se transformer comme les monstres peut paraitre bonne, mais vraiment elle reste tres anedoctique. Et je suis passez assez rapidement sur les graphismes mais franchement, sa passe vraiment de commentaire, des dessins d'enfant et encore...

Une poignée de niveaux supoudré de quelques monstres et gemmes parcemé par ci par la, des "mini-jeux" qui dure même pas quelque seconde et surtout et bon dieu .... DES DLC ?!! DES DLC POUR UN JEUX EN EARLY ACCES ?! C'est bien beau de faire des niveaux bonus sur le theme d'Halloween et de Noel, mais il aurais été mieux de faire un VRAI jeux plutot que des DLC inutile qui alourdie le jeux inutilement !! 

Certes le dévelopeur l'a fait avec coeur et est partie de rien pour faire son jeux. Mais a 5e, ce jeux est une véritable ARNAQUE et je pese mes mots ! Pour ce même prix, ont peut avoir des jeux de qualité comme FEZ, Meat Boy quand ils sont en promo. 

Le dévellopeur devrais sincerement s'activé aulieu d'empocher l'argent en laissant un "jeux" dans un tel état. A évité !

review:
I don't know how this game ended up in my library, a bundle? My general stance is to not buy Early Access, so I don't know how to rate them.

I would say to wait until this is properly released, because currently it handles like someone fed your keyboard/controller sugar mixed with meth. A tiny tap is translated as six to seven hundred taps, and it makes the game rather difficult. Difficult in the bad way.

The game spends a great deal of time trying to get the idea across that it is supposed to be super hard, a real rage quit experience, but it's doing it in the way that no one actually wants to experience. Super Meat Boy is a real rage quitter, but that's because it's a challenge in the reflexes and puzzle solving sense. You are using super tight control and intuitive feedback to overcome an experience.

This game just gives you awful controls and next to no feedback on your actions and just says, "Well, uh, it's supposed to be hard!"

So yeah, wait and see if this is eventually released in a playable state.

review:
It has the potential to be an amusing little game but the controls (keyboard and controller) need work. You have to CONSTANTLY tap to fly if you are in the shape of one the flying aliens. It is more awkward on the controller if you add the fact that the left stick is up/down and the right is L/R, it isn't all one stick to move, which is very common sense and normal in controller games. Jump is spastic sometimes, giving you a give burst jump, or at least it seems that way. Transforming causes you to do a little "hiccup" and if you are too close to an edge, you fall off because of that (which, with many of the corners rounded, you slip off instead of teetering on the edge). Music gets VERY annoying fast since it is like a 5 second bit on constant repeat.



I REALLY hope this game gets updated with some decent updates, because I'd like to come back and try it some more. For now, I will just let it finish running in the background to get my last couple card drops. 

I will update this when and if there is a major update or several smaller ones, and I've retried it. For now, I do not recommend this game.

review:
Informacja: To ostateczna wersja recenzji tej gry. Gra wygląda na porzuconą w niedokończonym stanie i zapewne tak zostanie.

Blob from Space to gra zręcznościowo-platformowa, w której naszym zadaniem jest doprowadzić naszego zmiennokształtnego Bloba do teleportera, który wyślę nas na kolejny poziom, których jest 5.
Gra przez 4 lata jest we wczesnym dostępie i przez ten czas twórcy coś tam próbowali, ale od 10 miesięcy ta niedokończona gra nie dostała żadnej aktualizacji a tym samym można uznać, że gra jest porzucona, to jak mocno jest niedokończona świadczy już same menu główne z połową działających opcji oraz poblokowany ekran wyboru światów(?), można wręcz powiedzieć, że jest to demo gry.
Od początków tej gry nie było w niej żadnej fabuły poza tym co sugeruje opis, jedyny rozwój w tej sprawie był w tamtym roku, gdzie wprowadzono suchy tekst między poziomami z możliwością wyboru odpowiedzi i nic więcej.
Gameplay jest ubogi, mamy dostępne tylko 5 poziomów, które są całkiem dobrze skonstruowane oraz są znajdźki do zbierania oraz naszego Bloba, który potrafi skakać po ścianach oraz przemieniać się w potwory, które spotykamy na naszej drodze, przejmując też ich zdolności jak np. latanie. Widać, że twórcy mieli dobry pomysł na grę, ale bez budżetu raczej ich to przerosło.
Graficznie gra nie wygląda tragicznie, ale też nie urywa z fotela, mimo wszystko poprawili grafikę przez te 4 lata, a do muzyki nie mam uwag.
Sterowanie w grze jest dosyć udziwnione, o ile nie mam większych zastrzeżeń co do ogólnego sterowania tak nie wiem kto wpadł na pomysł by wykorzystać prawą gajge w padzie do sterowania naszą postacią po przemianie w latającego stworka na boki i jest to bardzo dziwne. Co do innych aspektów technicznych typu błędy czy glitche to trudno coś takiego znaleźć jeżeli jest tu na tyle mało rzeczy, które mogły by się psuć, gra też działa bez zarzutów.

Więc plusy i minusy:

Plusy:
+Muzyka, którą da się słuchać
+Ciekawy pomysł na gameplay
+W miarę dobra konstrukcja poziomów

Neutralne:
+-Udziwnione momentami sterowanie, które da się przeżyć
+-Znajdźki
+-Taka sobie grafika, mogłobyć lepiej
+-Choć działa bez zastrzeń to nie ma się co tu psuć

Minusy:
-Poza muzyką nic tutaj nie wydaje dźwięków
-Połowa niedostępnych funkcji
-Brak fabuły
-Krótka
-Wybrakowana
-Po 4 latach nadal w Early Access i wygląda na porzuconą

Moja ocena to 2/10, widać że gra miała potencjał i był pomysł, tylko co z tego skoro tą grą nikt się nie zajmuję już prawie rok i gracze zostali jedynie z grywalnym demo, które wygląda jakby coś tam jeszcze miało być, ale tego nie ma. Jeżeli myślałeś nad zakupem tej gry to odradzam i nie polecam.

review:
This game was not enjoyable, at all.

The gameplay is okay, as far as platformers go, but unappealing graphics and repetitive music make it really hard to want to play it for a long period of time.

Pros:
+ steam cards;
+ the option to turn the music off before it gives you a headache.

Cons:
- music (consisting of a two second loop, that keeps repeating forever);
- uninspired level and character design;
- rounded platform edges, which force you to fall to your death over and over.

It would be great, if there was an option of a continue, but you only get three lives and when you're out of them, you have to start from the very beginning.

I think this game definitely has some potential, but in the current state it's just not worth it.

You could try it out if it's in a bundle or on sale, but I definitely don't recommend buying it for the full price.

[h1]15 Minut z kosmosu[/h1]

Jakkolwiek gra miała jakiś potencjał, to niestety nie został on w niej wykorzystany. Grę można przejść w dosłownie 15 minut, sterowanie jest stosunkowo toporne ale można się do niego przyzwyczaić, dodatkowe mini-gry zapewniają dodatkowe 5-10 minut zabawy. Recenzja dotyczy gry w fazie wczesnego dostępu, ale to co gra oferuje w obecnenej chwili nie możnaby nawet jeszcze nazwać wersją demonstracyjną.

Co zabawne, nie ważne czy gra się komuś spodobała czy też nie, aby zdobyć wszystkie karty kolekcjonerskie Blob From Space należy zostawić grę uruchomioną w tle, bo nawet po dwukrotnym przejściu gry i mini-gier najprawdopodobniej gracz nie zdobędzie jeszcze chociażby 2 kart.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995785961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1414057560}
review:
Blob From Space es un juego importante. 

Hablemos objetivamente. Blob From Space es un juego de plataformas 2D. Sus mecánicas se basan en saltar, esquivar enemigos y transformarte en dichos enemigos para superar diversos obstáculos. A lo largo del nivel podemos encontrar objetos que aumentarán nuestra puntuación y desbloqueables cosméticos en forma de sombreros. Está compuesto por siete niveles cuya duración oscila entre los 1 y 3 minutos. También incluye dos modos de juego extra: uno basado en conseguir la máxima puntuación posible en un espacio limitado, y otro basado en resolver complejos puzzles (por ahora sólo hay dos niveles). Tiene cartas, no muy caras. Fue dado gratis durante una promoción.

Blob From Space es un juego importante. 

Hablemos subjetivamente. El juego es una basura inmunda. Control horrendo, extremadamente corto y falto de contenido, con una gran cantidad de bugs. Es el concepto de Early Access llevado al límite, ya no es que sea un juego en fase alfa, es literalmente un proyecto hecho en un par de tardes. Y es precisamente por esto por lo que Blob From Space es un juego importante. Estoy convencido de que hay algo más allá de la jeta del desarrollador; hay una chispa de genialidad en este intento de empujar hasta el esperpento las capacidades del Early Access. 

Sí, Blob From Space es exactamente eso. Es una crítica social. Tiene un mensaje difícil de ver, pues se oculta entre sus horribles menúes y sus logros llenos de referencias culturales pasadas de moda. Blob From Space es una crítica a Early Access. Es un intento de demostrar que no vale para nada, puesto que este análisis carece de valided ya que "oye, no es la versión final, aún puede mejorar". No lo hará. Puede que nunca salga de Early Access, y sería comprensible, porque entonces el juego carecería de mensaje, no sería más que otro juego con un 3/100 en Metacritic en el océano de Bad Rats que es Steam. El desarrollador ha demostrado tener un gran valor a la hora de crear este juego; sabe que sus futuros proyectos estarán bajo la sombra de éste, se arriesga a duras palabras en Twitter por parte de ignorantes que no han captado la idea detrás del juego. Por eso le aplaudo.

Pero el juego es una mierda. Por eso le casco negativo. Pero eso sí, una mierda importante.

I had opportunity to test this game in early access, so I'm giving my review of this game.

-good, catchy music
-interesting graphics
-couple various enemies
-some different levels to play (not so many at the moment)
-CARDS (For collectors)
And those are the main benefits, i could see. Now let's focus on disadvantages, because "Blob From Space" got a large amount of those.
For example:
-bad controls
-keyboard bugs
-cheats system: you can't choose the level, which you want to play, because you need to know password for individual one
-sometimes you can fall out from the edges
-a little boring levels
---------and many more

In my opinion this game is not worth to be bought for full price, but I played early access, so maybe the game will be improved in the future.

review:
[b]Análisis subjetivo desde la versión en "Acceso anticipado" de este juego. [/b]
Desde ya no lo recomiendo para nada, existen docenas de titulos también con acceso anticipado (incluso del mismo género y estructura) que son una compra que puede valer más la pena, honestamente. Este juego es una versión que da a pensar que no llevó mucho trabajo al realizarse y que facilmente puede ser catalogado como un juego flash de internet debido a su sencillez. 

No me tomó más de 3 horas en ver todo el contenido de este juego, aunque no haya pasado todos los niveles que nos ofrecen ya es algo muy predecible saber lo que puede venir en el siguiente; muy repetitivo y con ideas notablemente extraidas de títulos exitosos... Cabe destacar que el movimiento de nuestro personaje en este juego es bastante dificultoso, lo que empeora la experiencia, más allá de "aprender a jugar", simplemente mover al personaje se vuelve una tarea tediosa. ¿Cromos, logros? No esconden lo mucho que le falta a este trabajo para valer incluso lo poco que cuesta.
Si tienes el dinero para comprarlo, mejor ahórralo para otro juego que puede valer cada centavo, porque este lamentablemente te dejará arrepentido.

2/10.
